content:
Sure, here are some recent works that feature similar representations of queer love and relationships:

1. The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo by Taylor Jenkins Reid - This novel explores the life of a Hollywood actress named Evelyn Hugo, who had relationships with both men and women throughout her career. It delves into themes of identity, love, and fame.

2. Her Body and Other Parties by Carmen Maria Machado - This collection of short stories features LGBTQ characters and relationships. It explores themes of desire, power, and body image.

3. Red, White & Royal Blue by Casey McQuiston - This novel follows the romance between the son of the President of the United States and a British prince. It deals with themes of identity, politics, and family.

4. Mostly Dead Things by Kristen Arnett - This novel follows a young woman named Jessa-Lynn who takes over her family's taxidermy business after her father's sudden death. It features LGBTQ characters and relationships and explores themes of grief, family, and self-discovery.

5. On Earth We're Briefly Gorgeous by Ocean Vuong - This novel is a coming-of-age story that follows the life of a young Vietnamese-American man named Little Dog. It explores the complexities of his family relationships, as well as his identities and relationships as a gay man. 

All of these works have been published in the last few years and feature diverse representation of LGBTQ characters and relationships, much like the works of Alison Bechdel.
